abstracts.cdata!:
This project is rated as satisfactory,
            having demonstrated that large markets for natural gas can
            be economically developed in parallel with the upgrading of
            Indonesian expertise to plan and manage the process. Key
            lessons learned are essentially the same as those drawn from
            the overlapping Gas Distribution Project (see report number
            13889): Long-term technical collaboration (twinning) of the
            state gas corporation (PNG) with an experienced operating
            entity was successful in institutional development and
            technology transfer, providing a broad-based package of
            technical assistance, integrated know-how transfer, and
            staff training. Gas supplies must be assured before a
            commitment with customers is firmed up. Gas marketing should
            lead infrastructure investment in order to minimize idle
            investment, avoid reducing the company's bargaining
            position vis-a-vis customers, and maintain its profit
            margin. Integrating gas supply and the reticulation system
            maximizes economic gains by balancing supply and demand, and
            minimizing investment and operating cost. Outsourcing
            project implementation activities enables implementation of
            expansion projects and minimizes employee establishment
            costs. An appropriate legal and regulatory framework should
            be in place to ensure compliance with agreements and
            efficient development of the gas chain from production to
            utilization. During project preparation, Bank staff should
            guide the establishment and maintenance of separate project accounts.

abstracts.cdata!:
Given the abundance of gas reserves and
            its relatively low marginal cost to develop, the natural gas
            subsector offers wide opportunities for pursuing the energy
            development strategy.  The primary objective is to
            accelerate the substitution of exportable petroleum product
            fuels with nonexportable natural gas.  This would be
            achieved through : a) provision of an assured supply of
            natural gas to power plants, manufacturing industries and
            commercial entities in Surabaya, and 12 other towns in its
            vicinity in East Java and in Medan in North Sumatra; b) the
            integration of gas utilization plans and operations to
            facilitate balanced development; and c) institution
            building, technology transfer, and marketing studies to
            accelerate safe and efficient use of natural gas and to help
            plan its long-term development.  The project consists of the
            following components : 1) design and construction of a
            natural gas supply system for Surabaya and its environs and
            expansion of the natural gas supply system for Medan; 2)
            technical assistance involving enhancement of PGN's
            skills in growth management, establishment of a Gas
            Technology Development Unit in LEMIGAS and upgrading of
            skills in MIGAS to facilitate institution of a regulatory
            system for safe use of natural gas; and 3) feasibility
            studies for natural gas marketing in Palembang, Jambi, Batam
            Island and Balikpapan.
